header: Criminal Bail Application No. 152/2019 (CNR No. MHPU01­000630­2019) Vinod Shantilal Lodha and Anr. Vs. State of Maharashtra (Through Shirur P.S.)

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 Applicants Vinod Shantilal Lodha and Shivaji Maruti Yadav have filed this application under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure for the grant of Ad­interim Anticipatory Bail in connection with C.R.No. 0862/2018 under Section 384, 385, 504, 506 r/w. 34 of the Indian Penal Code. and 49 of the Prevention of Money Lending Act.

arguments.text: [2] Heard the Ld. Counsel for the Applicants.

argumentSentences.text: [2] Heard the Ld. Counsel for the Applicants.

arguments.text: [3] It is alleged in the complaint that, the complainant Ashok Sadashiv Karande from the year 2008 till 2013 time to time borrowed money on interest from Applicant Nos. 1 and 2 for business purpose. However, the complainant had not paid the interest amount to Applicant No.1 and then Applicant No. 1 threatened to the complainant. If the complainant not paid the interest amount, he will take necessary legal action against the complainant. It is alleged that the applicant No. 2 demanded double interest on the principal amount from the complainant, also threatened complainant and forcefully taken two cheques from the complainant. On these allegations, the applicants prosecuted.

argumentSentences.text: [3] It is alleged in the complaint that, the complainant Ashok Sadashiv Karande from the year 2008 till 2013 time to time borrowed money on interest from Applicant Nos. 1 and 2 for business purpose.
However, the complainant had not paid the interest amount to Applicant No.1 and then Applicant No. 1 threatened to the complainant.
If the complainant not paid the interest amount, he will take necessary legal action against the complainant.
It is alleged that the applicant No. 2 demanded double interest on the principal amount from the complainant, also threatened complainant and forcefully taken two cheques from the complainant.
On these allegations, the applicants prosecuted.

arguments.text: [4] The Ld. Counsel for Applicants stated that, the applicants are innocent and have not committed any offence. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is not required. Nothing incriminating has to be discovered or recovered at the instance of applicants. The ingredients of Section 49 of Money Lending Act is not attracted. The applicants have not done any over act. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is not necessary. Hence, prayed for ad­interim protection.

arguments.text: [5] After hearing the Ld. Counsel for the applicants, there is reasonable apprehension in the mind of the applicants about their arrest at the hands of non­applicant. Hence, as settled position of Law, the Applicants are entitled for ad­interim Anticipatory bail till filing of reply by the Opponent. Hence, following order :­

argumentSentences.text: [5] After hearing the Ld. Counsel for the applicants, there is reasonable apprehension in the mind of the applicants about their arrest at the hands of non­applicant.
Hence, as settled position of Law, the Applicants are entitled for ad­interim Anticipatory bail till filing of reply by the Opponent.

order.text: ORDER 1] In the event of arrest of the applicants ­ Vinod Shantilal Lodha and Shivaji Maruti Yadav in the matter of C.R.No. 0862/2018 under Section 384, 385, 504, 506 r/w. 34 of the Indian Penal Code and 49 of the Prevention of Money Lending Act. registered at Shirur Police Station, Pune, they be released on their executing P.R. Bond of Rs.15,000/­ each and surety each of like amount. 2] The above mentioned interim protection of ad­interim anticipatory bail is granted, till filing of reply by the Opponent. 3] Issue show cause notice to PSO PS Shirur Police Station r/on. 16.01.2019.

processedText:
Criminal Bail Application No. 152/2019 (CNR No. MHPU01­000630­2019) Vinod Shantilal Lodha and Anr. Vs. State of Maharashtra (Through Shirur P.S.) 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 Applicants Vinod Shantilal Lodha and Shivaji Maruti Yadav have filed this application under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure for the grant of Ad­interim Anticipatory Bail in connection with C.R.No. 0862/2018 under Section 384, 385, 504, 506 r/w. 34 of the Indian Penal Code. and 49 of the Prevention of Money Lending Act. 
---background-ends---
[2] Heard the Ld. Counsel for the Applicants. 
---argument-ends---
[3] It is alleged in the complaint that, the complainant Ashok Sadashiv Karande from the year 2008 till 2013 time to time borrowed money on interest from Applicant Nos. 1 and 2 for business purpose. However, the complainant had not paid the interest amount to Applicant No.1 and then Applicant No. 1 threatened to the complainant. If the complainant not paid the interest amount, he will take necessary legal action against the complainant. It is alleged that the applicant No. 2 demanded double interest on the principal amount from the complainant, also threatened complainant and forcefully taken two cheques from the complainant. On these allegations, the applicants prosecuted. 
---argument-ends---
[4] The Ld. Counsel for Applicants stated that, the applicants are innocent and have not committed any offence. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is not required. Nothing incriminating has to be discovered or recovered at the instance of applicants. The ingredients of Section 49 of Money Lending Act is not attracted. The applicants have not done any over act. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is not necessary. Hence, prayed for ad­interim protection. 
---argument-ends---
[5] After hearing the Ld. Counsel for the applicants, there is reasonable apprehension in the mind of the applicants about their arrest at the hands of non­applicant. Hence, as settled position of Law, the Applicants are entitled for ad­interim Anticipatory bail till filing of reply by the Opponent. Hence, following order :­ 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] In the event of arrest of the applicants ­ Vinod Shantilal Lodha and Shivaji Maruti Yadav in the matter of C.R.No. 0862/2018 under Section 384, 385, 504, 506 r/w. 34 of the Indian Penal Code and 49 of the Prevention of Money Lending Act. registered at Shirur Police Station, Pune, they be released on their executing P.R. Bond of Rs.15,000/­ each and surety each of like amount. 2] The above mentioned interim protection of ad­interim anticipatory bail is granted, till filing of reply by the Opponent. 3] Issue show cause notice to PSO PS Shirur Police Station r/on. 16.01.2019. 
---order-ends---
Sd/­ Pune ( G.P.Agrawal ) Date : 09/01/2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. CERTIFICATE I affirm that the contents of this P.D.F. file order are same word to word as per original order. Name of Steno : Smt. S.N.Kale Name of Court : G.P.Agrawal Addl. Sessions Judge,Pune. Order delivered on : 09/01/2019 Order signed on : 09/01/2019 Order uploaded on : 10/01/2019
